column4: UPDATE 1-SuccessFactors to buy peer for $110 mln
column5: Dec 6 Human resources management software maker SuccessFactors Inc  which has been acquired by SAP AG  said it will buy privately held peer jobs2web for $110 million in cash  as it ramps up its services.

column4: Analysis: SAP's new cloud czar to take on Salesforce  Oracle
column5: SAP AG's purchase of Web-based software company SuccessFactors Inc could be the catalyst the old-school German technology giant needs to try to catch up to rivals in the fast-growing cloud computing market.

column4: UPDATE 2-Norway's Frontline restructures to battle downturn
column5: OSLO  Dec 6 Frontline  the largest independent global oil tanker operator  has unveiled a restructuring plan that will spare its investors a lot of pain and force Ship Finance International to take a big hit.

column4: UPDATE 1-SunTrust CEO says mortgage buybacks rise in Q4
column5: Dec 6 SunTrust Banks Inc's  fourth-quarter mortgage repurchase costs will be "well above" those of previous periods  the regional bank's chief executive said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 3-TE Connectivity targets $20 billion sales by 2015
column5: Dec 6 Connector maker TE Connectivity Ltd affirmed its 2012 sales and profit forecast on Tuesday and said it aimed for at least $20 billion in sales by its 2015 fiscal year.

column4: Sandvine shares plunge on weak outlook
column5: Network equipment maker Sandvine Corp  said it expects fourth-quarter revenue to fall by about a fifth as some of its largest customers hold back on spending  sending its shares down 31 percent to a two-year low.

column4: Blackstone Asia head eyes growth in China  Southeast Asia
column5: HONG KONG Blackstone Group L.P.  sees China and Southeast Asia as top destinations for Asia investments next year as it aims to benefit from buoyant consumer markets there  the Asia-Pacific head of the private equity firm said on Tuesday.

column4: Toll Brothers results beat Street  margins rise
column5: Luxury homebuilder Toll Brothers Inc  reported higher-than-expected quarterly profit from greater margins  and issued a forecast for new orders that may reflect a bottoming of the U.S. housing market following a long decline.

column4: UPDATE 2-Toll Brothers results beat Street  margins strong
column5: Dec 6 Luxury homebuilder Toll Brothers Inc reported higher-than-expected quarterly sales and earnings as gross margins topped forecasts.

column4: UPDATE 1-Toro Q4 beats Street; sees strong 2012
column5: Dec 6 Toro Co reported better-than-expected quarterly results  helped by a 14 percent rise in its professional segment sales and guided 2012 results above analysts' expectations.

column4: TransMontaigne to increase Miss.  Ohio tankage
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 6 TransMontaigne Partners LP said on Tuesday that it would increase the capacity at its Collins  Mississippi and East Liverpool  Ohio terminals.

column4: Unilever prepares for UK strike on Dec. 9
column5: LONDON  Dec 6 Consumer goods maker Unilever Plc/NV  said customers would not be affected by its first strike in Britain on Friday by workers who are fighting the axing of their final salary pension scheme.

column4: Exclusive: Verizon to take on Netflix with Web service
column5: NEW YORK Verizon Communications Inc plans to launch a standalone service allowing customers to stream movies and television shows over the Web  in a fresh challenge to Netflix Inc and the traditional cable TV business  according to several people briefed on the plan.

column4: Exclusive: Verizon to take on Netflix with Web service
column5: NEW YORK Verizon Communications Inc plans to launch a standalone service allowing customers to stream movies and television shows over the Web  in a fresh challenge to Netflix Inc and the traditional cable TV business  according to several people briefed on the plan.

column4: UPDATE 3-Wells Fargo well positioned for stress test - CEO
column5: Dec 6 Wells Fargo & Co is "well positioned" for upcoming stress tests of the largest U.S. banks  Chief Executive John Stumpf said on Tuesday.

column2: Yingli Green Energy Holding Company Limited
column4: Analysis: Solar companies to seek deep pockets in downturn
column5: Struggling solar manufacturers will likely be driven into mergers with rivals to survive a sector squeeze  a trend that could draw major Asian conglomerates deeper into the renewable energy sector.

column4: UPDATE 1-Nevsun sees no impact from UN sanctions on Eritrea
column5: Dec 6 Canadian gold producer Nevsun Resources Ltd said United Nations sanctions against Eritrea should have no direct impact either on the company or its mining operations in the African country.
